subject: AI & Agents
title: Sequence-Aware Recommendations
description: A micro-lesson that makes Sequence-Aware Recommendations usable.

hook.text: You watched a cooking show, then a travel show. Context: you're planning a food trip.

buildup.text: Traditional CF ignores order. Sequence models capture temporal patterns in user behavior.

discovery.text: Architectures: RNNs, GRUs, Transformers process the user's interaction history as a sequence.

twist.text: The most recent items matter more than items from 6 months ago. Recency weighting is essential.

climax.text: Amazon's 'frequently bought together' is a simple sequence pattern. Transformers go much deeper.

punchline.text: Order matters. Model the sequence, not just the set.

quiz.question: What do sequence-aware recommenders capture?
options: Temporal patterns and order in user behavior
